messages.message: After pulling the latest changes from instabase/master , I tried restarting all services using multiple terminals and on trying to open a .ibflow file it shows an error like this! can anyone please help?
Does it work if you do localhost/… instead of localhost:5000/… ?
Can you please try that URL without the port (:5000)?
chrome restricts loading , do I need to set any flags?
Either one is fine, was just curious (you can use provisioner from multiple terminals as well). :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks it works now  !! :tada: was just curious regarding the webapp, it is still listening on port 5000 as well! why is that so?
webapp the service always listens on 5000, it used to be a proxy as well for local development
Now the proxy is handled in nginx like it is in a deployment, so the proxy in webapp is no longer enabled (which is why you get 404s when going directly to webapp)
Webapp is now just webapp, and no longer overloaded with additional functionality for local dev :slightly_smiling_face:
regarding using the provisioner, Let’s say changing the code a bit,  one can run it , even if multiple terminals are up and running . Is that what you (@will) meant? :thinking_face:
would running the provisioner from any terminal rebuild eveyrthing necessary? or How does that work?

I don’t think so. Since you can specify individual services, there is nothing to stop you from using it in multiple terminals to start/stop/rebuild etc each service individually, similar to using the make file but with a common command and an extra layer of abstraction.
It would be similar to the `make` work flow in multiple terminals, since you could tell it to compile each service.
